questions.question: Does the edited image retain a central object resembling a monitor, even in a stylized form?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there's an object at the center that closely resembles the shape and size of the monitor from Image A. Its screen is centrally located and flat, characteristic of a typical computer monitor. Thus, even though Image B is stylized, it retains the core element of a monitor.

questions.question: Does the edited image include an object resembling a speaker, even in a stylized form?
questions.explanation: Image B includes an object to the left of the central monitor-like object, which retains a similar shape and position to the speaker seen in Image A. This object still has the characteristic appearance of a speaker, including circular elements that resemble the speakerâ€™s drivers.

questions.question: Does the edited image include an object resembling a computer tower, even in a stylized form?
questions.explanation: In Image B, on the right side relative to the monitor, there's an object similar in shape and position to the computer tower found in Image A. This suggests an intention to stylize the computer tower while keeping its recognizable shape.

questions.question: Does the edited image include an object resembling a keyboard, even in a stylized form?
questions.explanation: Image B shows an object situated in front of the monitor which closely mimics the elongated, rectangular shape of a keyboard. This suggests that the keyboard is retained in stylized form.

questions.question: Does the edited image include an object resembling a mouse, even in a stylized form?
questions.explanation: In Image B, there is an object resembling a mouse placed beside the keyboard-like structure, matching the positioning of a typical computer mouse. Such placement and form hint at the intention to retain a mouse shape in the stylized depiction.
